snippet: In a typical election, having prosecutors declare that a top adviser to a candidate was aware of a plot like the 2013 George Washington Bridge closing would have enormous ramifications....
abstract: Political Memo; Donald Trump says he will still retain New Jersey Gov Chris Christie as presidential campaign adviser even after United States attorney's office prosecutor Vikas Khanna confirms that Christie was aware of intentional lane shutdown on George Washington Bridge in 2013; atypical move for presidential candidate highlights how Trump rewards loyal colleagues, despite political ramifications.
lead_paragraph: In a typical election, having prosecutors declare that a top adviser to a candidate was aware of a plot like the 2013 George Washington Bridge closing would have enormous ramifications.

headline.print_headline: Trump Stands by Christie Despite Bridge Allegations
headline.main: Donald Trump Stands by Chris Christie Despite Revelations in Bridge Closing Trial
